block.p: The five most e-mailed articles from nytimes.com/sports for May 26 to June 1.

1. Concussions Tied to Depression in Ex-N.F.L. Players Findings from a general health survey of 2,552 retired players by the University of North Carolina's Center for the Study of Retired Athletes. (Published May 31)
2. Danish Cyclist Admits Doping in Tour Victory A confession by Bjarne Riis, who won the Tour de France in 1996. (May 26)
3. With a New Sock, the Red Sox Add Some Distance Five-toed hosiery from Japan catches on. (May 24)
4. To Love and to Cherish for All Eternity, or Not A fan divorces herself from her beloved but disappointing Yankees. (May 27)
5. Take Me Out to the Baggage Check For a price, fans may stash their oversized bags before entering Yankee Stadium. (May 25)
